result.execSummary:
The defendant Shante L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shante L Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment for failure to pay as ordered.
10 days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Shante L Johnson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  6 days  in the House of Correction,  with credit for 6 days time served.  

Fine of $350.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges  to be paid $30.00 forthwith and balance  by 12-30-16 or serve 10 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Shante L Johnson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

 Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shante L Johnson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Shante L Johnson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Shante L Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
